content:
14, 2014
												Only buy this game if it's 75 cents or less.Legendary has it's upsides, the most notable being the premise of the game. Griphons and other mythological creatures invading the modern world is the selling point of this game, and it ends there. Literally everything else about the game is bad or poorly imagined.First off, this game is broken. Absolutely, fundamentally broken. You literally can not beat this game if you just install it and play it. Right before the final level, there is a game-breaking glitch that causes you to fall through the floor. It is impossible to complete the game. There are a few files you can change to fix this, but the fact that this is included in the game shows how little the developers care, and how poorly the game was ported to PC.The gameplay is boring and repetative. There are about 3 enemy types you will regularly be fighting throughout the game, most of which are just cannon fodder. A plus gameplay wise is that you get health by absorbing enemy souls, and I find this to be the only redeeming quality of this game in a world of regenerating health shooters.The environments and character design are actually pretty decent. AI teammates will occasionally warp through walls, and you can stand inside of them as well. Friendly character clipping wasn't taken into account at all. The animations for most characters are done nicely, but some enemies have poor animation cycles when waiting for a cutscene event.Cutscenes in this game aren't impressive in the slightest. Every time you beat a major story plot point, you are given a slideshow of images and text that is read aloud. The most dissapointing part of the game is at the very end. After you fix the glitch and get to the final level, you complete 3 simple tasks and are given a wall of text. I have never been so dissapointed with an ending since watching Evangelion.My final verdict is to get it on sale. As a game, it isn't so bad that it should be avoided, but you should definitely not pay full price for it. This game is common in indie bundles and I've seen it go as low as $0.74 (£0.59) on Steam.

content:
ry 13, 2014
												So if you haven't noticed yet, this game doesn't get the best reviews, but this is more of a neutral review. Since steam doesn't give me a neutral option I will put to not recommend. My reasoning behind this is because for the most part the game has a lot of technical problems and one huge game breaking bug that happened in an elevator that leads to the final battle of the game, with all these issues I can't bring myself to recommend this even if I enjoyed it. One issue I had was the controls, the way your character moves is very stiff, he jumps like 2 inches off the ground which is annoying when there are some vital points in the game where you need the ability to jump a little, but when you sprint he's all over the place. Another technical issue is the shooting, they have a weird delay from when you shoot the gun to when its supposed to register on the enemy, this makes shooting moving targets more difficult, but it seems to only occur when you shoot human enemies. There are a few more but those are the most important ones to know about, the big elevator glitch I pointed out earlier (which would drop me through the floor of the elevator when it started to move ending up in me falling forever or being stuck below the level) took me a while to find a fix for, some people said to mess around in the ini files, some people said to look at an angle, some said to use FRAPS to limit the fps of the game, so what fixed it was a combo of everything. Multiplayer for me at least was out of the question based the problems with the single player and the fact that you didn't a different account just to play it. But not all is bad with this game, I like the story of fighting a bunch of mythical creatures who were let out because the character you play as was hired/tricked to open Pandora's Box, and the whole game nobody really busts his balls over it, they just accept that he did it and tries to fix it. The creatures are amazing, each one brings their own challanges, Minotaurs are fast, strong, and take awhile to kill while Nari's are more stealthy, come in packs, and are invicible untill they get ready to attack. I was surprised by some of the great face animations from the characters while in game (not cutscenes) reminded me a lot of BioShock Infinite. Some people complain about the graphics but to me they were pretty good especially for the time this came out. The game was very action packed, you are constantly going against something that surprises you and keeps you on your toes, watching massives golems destory the city while griffons fly over head is just one of the wonderful sights of the environment around you will your fighting. I do wish there were more enemies just to bring more diversity and a longer single player experience. This is a decent game that I feel is haunted by a lot of technical issues, I would recommend it with a warning but in this case I don't think most people would enjoy this as much as me, but if you can get it for cheap you have nothing to lose, give it a shot.

number of helpful: 89 of 116 people (77%) found this review helpful10 people found this review funny
content:
er 23, 2014
												Legendary is a horror action first person shooter in the fashion of Duke Nukem Forever and Half-Life 2. Horror as in blood and gory, but not scary, its action first. You have unlocked Pandora's Box, and you'll have to fight mythological creatures to present day New York City and London. You'll fight flying griffins, charging minotaurs, sneaky werewolves, and yes someone released the Kraken. The thing that stands out about the game are the fights. Not just you fighting the enemies, but your allies fighting a hostile faction and enemies attacking everything living. It all adds to a level of strategy. Do you shoot open the lock to a werewolf's cage and have it attack your enemies? Do you flank your enemies while your allies keep them occupied or throw a grenade? One enemy can attack another and light it on fire. Combat isn't scripted. Your allies will die and that's okay. You can leave them, you're not chained to them, but they do help you.The game has brief cut scenes, THAT ARE NOT SKIPABLE. Some of the cut scenes are like an advanced slide show with beautiful art and voice overs. I'd rather see that when interluding between things. There is humor here and there. About once every two hours without being in your face. The game will tell you where to go, what to do with voice overs, because that's what first person shooters do. Thankfully this one says use the rocket launcher against that griffin instead of hold that button, to lock on the griffin, then press that button to fire the rocket. So it keeps me in game. What doesn't keep me in game is the loading screen when I died. I died a lot on medium difficulty when it came to the bosses. I'd say more than other similar first person shooters. There is no easy health. No health kits, no regenerating health at least on medium difficulty. Things will crush you, such as the Kraken's giant purple tentacles. You need to stay sharp and look up.When you start the game, you're given incredible hand powers to do three things. You can absorb what I'll call "souls" from dead creatures. Absorbing souls takes time and you need to hold down the button, but if there are 3 souls in 1 area it only needs to be done once to absorb all souls. With these souls you can either hold the same hand button to heal yourself or double press it to send out a wave that stuns enemies. Other than that the weapons are pretty basic, you have a pistol (which I never used), shotgun, machine gun, assault rifle, heavy machine gun, flame thrower for giant swarming blood ticks and rocket launcher. Every weapon has 'iron sights.' The rocket launcher will lock on a target, no matter where they move, the rocket will follow. The hidden gem here is the fire axe. With it you can break the arms of werewolves so they can't attack you. However, it makes a glitchy sort of dangling arm since its broken, not severed. You also have detonation grenades and molotov cocktails that start enemies on fire. With all that said, you can carry two guns at a time, in addition to both kinds of throwables and your fire axe.This is more of a spectacle first person shooter. A towering golem made of junk will walk through Times Square, Big Ben will get obliterated. What there won't be is any sort of exploration. This isn't Quake or Doom. Legendary only has winding maps with short deviations. Things like shoot this object to open a path and hold a button to flip a switch. There are challenges like hold this point for X amount of time. Kill werewolves and absorb their souls and use that to charge EMPs or generators. Kill the giant bosses. Rocket kill griffins. Its all engaging fun, even if you won't get lost. The game even has a waypoint button to see where to go, but I never use it.The enemies each feel unique. Drakes will pop out of fire, roll around and then either spit lava balls from a distance or spew massive amounts of fire like a dragon. You can use water to extinguish them. Werewolves feel like the most typical creature. They will climb up walls to attack from different angles. They have a standard melee, but they'll also throw objects like barrels and stones. If you attack their head, they'll block and they'll jump around. Once they're down you need to behead them or they'll come back. The hairless werewolves are easy enough, but the hairy ones are tougher. The navi are little ghost sprite imp things. In their ghost form you can't hurt them, but they will inhabit objects to attack. Either they'll throw objects or posses vending machines that will shoot cans at you. Minataurs and Griffins will smash an entire area to kill things. They'll go through pillars, walls, bookshelves and anything else. You are not safe. They will always find and kill. The only difference between them is one flies and screams, the other gets stunned after charging. Other than that, the main non boss creature is a tentacle. Green tentacles will attack from water and try to pull you to your instant death. Kill it before you die. If that wasn't enough there are typical soldiers to fight, just as you have your allies. They shoot guns and throw grenades your way when you stay out of sight. Its easy enough to headshot them if you're not using a shotgun. Their aim is too good if you're not hiding behind something. Plus since you don't get to take their soul when they're dead, there's no health from them either. There are cool armored flame throwing soldiers. It adds nice tension seeing them just walk at you making a wall of flame. A nice twist to the game is there are also creature controllers. You can use your soul energy to temporarily charge it and the creatures won't come after you. The game will respawn creatures at times (but not soldiers). Even if you've killed 100 werewolves in the same spot. If you stand there, more werewolves will come. So you need to move on. It'll only waste your ammo, but you have an excessive amount of it.I feel like the game has good intelligence. Soldiers will move back into cover when I flank them. Werewolves will flank to attack, even if some run straight up to you. However, the game's maps don't make good use of that intelligence until later maps. Most maps are just straight forward with cover and no flanking opportunity. Later maps have flank opportunities while your allies occupy enemies.The game looks great and there are a variety of atmospheric environments. New York City streets with cars everywhere, ancient ruins, a graveyard, sewers, subways and parliament libraries. but it feels like it has a fog or a haze over it. Even bright green things have a layer of gray. Maybe its gamma correction? Sometimes objects and characters have a white glowing hue. The fire and water look great. Enemies catch fire and dynamically light the area if not spread the fire. Water is everywhere in the game. You'll be trudging through sewers, walls will have water slicking down them and of course broken pipes. You can't run or jump while in water, although there was one time where I felt like I could. Maybe the water wasn't deep enough. Speaking of jump, its the most hilariously pathetic jump I've experienced. Yet while holding run and jump suddenly you shoot forward. I blame the Unreal engine. Even with all the water, you won't be swimming or anything other than walking and shooting.Overall, the game has silly glitches. Dead werewolves get stuck in the ground. Bullets can hit invisible walls when on staircases. Soldiers have incredible aim. Health is tough to come by. Ammo is too plentiful. I never ran out unless it was rockets. No saving, just check pointing. People in the forum and elsewhere complain about game breaking glitches, but I never ran into any. The graphics look foggy yet great. The cut scenes are unskipable. It has an air of AAA yet not AAA. Yet after all that, I still enjoy the game because of its enemies and their interactions. The game has been on sale for 50 cents before. Take a chance. Even if its to say LOLz Call of Duty with mythology.

content:
18, 2014
												An interesting game with some amazing visuals.  For once we get a fresh take on battling monsters, instead of taking place in the far flung fantasy filled past of wizards or knights, or in a galaxy far far away in some doom wannabe, we get a game that lets us take on mythological creatures of the past in the modern world.  This game does have bugs, its not perfect, and the controls are kind of shot.  Some strange bugs encountered was that the sun in the sky would appear through objects or when in an enclosed room or tunnel and one gamebreaking bug at the end of the game.  The game played with a keyboard and mouse is way to easy.   The controller controls arent great they skate around and the look or aim seems to often fly all over.  While normally I would hate that, this isnt a platformer where any precise jumps are required.  In a way the bad controls added to the challenge.  Somehow the floaty controls for aiming made me feel like I was there since noone would stay perfect in that situation with their aim.  Multiplayer is dead since gamespy is dead, but the story is fun, many of the visuals of the blown up burned out city are great.  Def worth a playthrough and if its too easy  just exit and change the difficulty.  To pass the elevator glitch that kills you at the end of the game go to "C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config" set framerate to 30, then play until the next checkpoint exit and set it back to 300.Rating:  5/10  Value:  $4.99

er 31, 2014
												I don't understand why this game's got such a bad rating. It's very old school similar to Doom, it's linear and you shoot everything that moves. The monsters are cool and the minotaurs can be hard to kill sometimes. I did not encounter any bugs except one, which I agree is game breaking. I took forumer ZanyCynic's advice below and was able to progress without any issues.To fix the Elevator bug, Open the PandoraEngine.ini (on vista it is on C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config-Folder) and search for"MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300" and change the value to 30. So the game runs at maximum 30 fps. Play through to next check point save then edit it back to 300 and continue game.I got this for 99 cents and it's well worth it if you pick it up during a sale. I defnitely recommend playing it if you like old school games like Doom, Quake and Farcry 1.

content:
31, 2015
												This game is better than most people say it is. I think it's a good thing this game got so much bad press, because you will go into it expecting crap, and you will be surprised by how not crap it is. Actually, you'll probably be amazed at all the scripted events and chaos and enemies lurking about. A griffon causing havoc, breaking into buildings and nearly taking your head off, another griffon flying through a cathedral... truly... this is some fantastic stuff for a game released in 2008. And it looks good too.Also, Legendary touches upon a story that, when you see Pandora's Box as a symbol for genetic splicing, is all too realistic and believable. I think this scares the haters and they don't want to admit it, so while in fear they just hate. For FPS games, this is pretty good. Granted, it's not the most engaging, but if you play the game with the mind that that awesome fireman's axe is your primary weapon and what you use for most of the game, believe me, this game all of a sudden becomes very engaging and worthwhile. The guns are pretty good, but there's something lacking in engaging enemies with them, but that axe... it's all about that axe and hunting werewolves with it. A good challenge is to face the first Minotaur with the axe. Grenades and molotovs are very welcome to use, but always weild that axe.The enemies, not including the humans, are also really well done. The Nari are very well scripted and a real treat to witness and axe to death. They go around lifting things and throwing them at you. They appear in front of your face and do a little mockery dance. They lift soda machines and cause the soda cans to fly out at you. The Nari truly make this game really enjoyable. Of course, they are an enemy, but a very unique enemy. It's obvious a lot of love went into creating them. Also, there's that game-breaking bug at the end, which solutions have been made available by players.If this game ever got achievements, it would only need one. I challenge all you players to earn it:Legendary - Beat the game weilding the fireman's axe for at least 80% of the gameThis is how you make a decent game more fun. Enjoy.

content:
er 12, 2014
												Here's a game with an interesting premise that falls flat. Gunplay is wonky, ADS is hard to control (and seems pointless anyway). Combat is, well, boring. Enemies have rudimentary AI that's easy to overcome. Human enemies tend to stick behind cover with their heads sticking out and stationary, making them easy one-shot kills. The constant werewolves are easy to take out with automatic fire, and if you have trouble with a minotaur, use a flamethrower. Ammunition is more than abundant, meaning that, even if you didn't have super-human accuracy, you'd still not run out. Constant "hold button to open door" prompts severely interrupt the flow of gameplay and probably are a result of consolitis, the press-and-hold prompts being a way to allow consoles to catchup on load times. Multiplayer is Gamespy-reliant, and thus non-existant. Also, there's a bug in the last elevator that causes you to fall through the floor, either killing you or leaving you falling forever. Since the devs won't fix it (claim they can't fix it), here's a solution I had to find. Open PandoraInput.iniChange Bindings=(Name=”PageDown”,Command=”dummy”) to Bindings=(Name=”PageDown”,Command=”walk“)Change Bindings=(Name=”PageUp”,Command=”dummy”) to Bindings=(Name=”PageUp”,Command=”ghost“)When you fall through the floor of the elevator, hit PageUp to go into noclip (ghost) mode, then follow the elevator. Get out of noclip mode when you catch up with it (PageDown). What should have been an amazing game with an excellent premise turned out to be about seven hours of just "meh" gameplay with an ending that has no resolution and promises a sequel we'll probably never see.If you see it for 50 cents, consider it, but only if you have nothing else to play in your library.

content:
r 20, 2016
I REALLY DON'T UNDERSTAND THE INCREDIBLY NEGATIVE REVIEWS.(here I'm expressing my strong disagreement with the negative reviews, if you're not interested in this, just scroll down for the actual review)1. I don't get it. What did people expect to get for 3 EUR? BordeIands 2 or Bioshock Infinite? Maybe Fallout 4? This game now normally costs 3 EUR, but during sale even less. I paid 0,74 EUR during a sale, (some got it for even less in bundles, etc.), and this is not even half as much as you would pay for a cup of coffee in a bar. Still, I have to say after I played the game for about an 1,5 h, I have already felt like I enjoyed myself much more than I would drinking a cup of coffee... 2. This game in many ways really feels like I'm playing an AAA title from 2008 - it is that good. Correct me if I'm wrong, but if you compare this game to other FPS games on Steam in the same price category, most (if not all) are not nearly as good as this game.You don't believe me? Check for yourself, these are the best FPS games that are under 5 EUR, check among them the ones that are normally priced 3 EUR or less and compare. So?http://store.steampowered.com/search/?sort_by=Reviews_DESC&tags=1663&category1=998&filter=ut2The point is, don't expect BordeIands 2 or Bioshock Infinite for a regular price of 3 EUR or less, but the game, despite being a somewhat mediocre & linear FPS, is still really good considering the current price tag.3. I realize this game can be a little confusing sometimes, but fact is this is not the only game on Steam where you might eventually need to check a gameplay video to be able to progress. There are countless of puzzle, point & click and even some FPS games where you'll at some point need to turn to a gameplay video for a little help. I think the game is good and fun to play despite this drawback.4. I also realize the game has some bugs and some people have reported having serious problems with the graphics suddenly becoming weird for no apparent reason (didn't have this issue myself), but there is a way to fix this:


How to FIX the clay texture/Low resolution problem. 
A Guide for Legendary
By: Crystal Bullet

			Hello and Welcome. If you're like me You purchased Legendary the game and Were hoping to get a good expierence from playing the game.		


5. Last but not least, some people have criticized the game for not having any story, but most of them haven't played the game for longer than 30min. Fact is this game has a good story, but it becomes revealed as you play. Furthermore there are many FPS that ACTUALLY don't have any story, but still have very good reviews on Steam and are quite popular, one example that comes to mind is Quake II - one of my all time faveroute FPS.So in conclusion to the ranting part of my review, I want to say, that if this game was 10 or 20 EUR, I could somewhat understand the negative reviews. But if you can get it for 3 EUR or less... as far as I'm concerned - it's a steal. GREAT GAME, really feels like an older AAA title.THE REVIEW: (the rating is considering the regular price tag the game has in time of writing)+ Graphics & Atmosphere: 10/10 (good atmosphere and really good graphics for a 2008 title - didn't age badly)+ Gameplay: 9/10(the game is a port, could be better, but generally the controls are good, experienced no issues worth mentioning, only minor ones like the aiming with the sniper gun being a little awkward, etc.)+ AI: 10/10(I found the AI surprisingly good for a 2008 game title in this price category)+ Story/Plot: 10/10(starts with many questions unanswered, but becomes more and more clear as you progress - overall good and different, not generic IMO)+ Voice Acting: 10/10(overall feels professional, as you'd expect from an AAA title)+ Settings / Options Menu: 10/10(had no problems with the settings/options menu - more or less what you'd generally expect in a well made AAA game)+ Fun Factor: 10/10(the games did not feel repetitive or boring)+/- Quite linear and somewhat mediocre.(but that didn't bother me, the game is still fun and I enjoyed playing it)+/- FPS elements variety isn't wast.(the opponents are not very varied, but IMO varied enough and also original, consisting mostly of mythological beings that entered our world from another dimension and are now wreaking havoc AND while the variety of weapons is not big, it does slowly grow as you progress, though you can carry only 2 different guns/pistols)+/- The game autosaves on save points. (if you die, you can restart from the last save point - the save points are well placed and frequent, so I had no problem with this)+/- Some cutscenes put INGAME.(there are instances where instead of making an actual cutscene, the devs decided to make something happen as you play (like a mythological creature attacking innocent people), but when you try to take part in the happening, you can't (like trying to save somebody from being killed, but your bullets are ineffective, because it is actually a cutscene) - I think the idea behind this is really good, but the execution... not so much.- The tutorial at the beginning of the game is good but doesn't teach you one very useful thing...(despite the game being very linear you might sometimes find yourself feeling lost / confused about where you're supposed to go next - if this happens to you, just press Q and a blue sign will appear to show you where you're supposed to go)- Be prepared to sometimes have to look at a GAMEPLAY VIDEO to know what you're supposed to do to progress. (there are instances when you might be unable to progress because of the puzzles in the game or because the game doesn't make it clear what it expects of you... for example there's a puzzle in the game, that involves shooting/destroying few barrels to be able to progress, but generally when you shoot things, most are not affected (so the game contradicts itself in this sense and confuses the player), OR you're suddenly trapped in a room and need to break a window to get out (totally unexpected solution for me) OR a griffin attacks you on a bridge and the squad commander shouts ''get off that bridge!'' but you can't, the solution is actually to use your special power to make the griffin fall off the bridge - otherwise it will kill you)- Graphics & Elevator bug(didn't experience the graphics bug myself, but there's a fix in the forums - I shared the link at the end of the first part of my review AND there is also a bug where on the elevator to the last level you fall through the floor, but you can bypass this problem by simply walking/running towards the back of the walls of the elevator and not stopping as it's going up - do this and the elevator will successfully take you to the top)CONCLUSION:Despite a few bugs and confusing moments, this game is still fun and quite enjoyable. IMO a very good game considering the price. I definitely RECOMMEND this game for purchase to anyone, who generally enjoys FPS and doesn't mind playing a very linear & somewhat mediocre, but also in many ways fun and interesting FPS title.

content:
, 2014
												I wish Steam had a neutral button.The Story, random guy has to steal the box of pandora but opened it by curiosity (or had to open it, idk it doesnt change anything) -> legendary creatures invade the capitals of some countrys -> you need to save itIs quite generic but also thanks to the creatures such as gryphons, minotaurs and werewolfs it had potential.Pro:- Recource System.  Once you killed a creature of the pandora you get energy that can be used as a knockback skill or selfheal. - The groundskeeper tbat randomly cleaned the military base in the middle of the game although the whole world is about to collaps (he sure likes his job, i enjoyed watching him ^-^... the fact that he is in the pro says pretty much all about the rest.. doesnt it?)- Atmosphere of the surface (shame you get to play mostly in subway stations and others so you cant see the scenery that much... destroying world seems to be nice)- The cracen as Boss was quite spectacular... RELEASE THE CRACEN!  (although he was not realy hard...)- The first time you get to face Minotaur and Gryphon as a enemy (miniboss), the feeling of the fight actually is pretty nice. After the first one you simply nuke them with rocket launcher or getlingun and that makes it quite dull again.Cons:- The last lvl has a BUGG where you have to change the maxframerate to 30 or you will get bugged in the elevator- too less monsters (you mostly fight against werewolfs... which first seem to be a nice enemy as you have to execute them, but you will soon notice that you do not need to lasthit him with a meleweapon but still simply shoot him... lame) - You actually fight more military men than monsters- The synchro is not that good (some maybe will think otherwise)- Whole game is based on checkpoint data which means that nothing is random in the world but actually spawns for you at the right moment... the checkpoint part also occurs for the military guys you get as support... they die about 1 or 2 minutes after you get them by default (mostly even secounds after you get them).... all... the....time..... that gets boring- The scoped version of the weapons is too fast and it is actually therefore easier to aim without scoping at all... (if you are playing ego shooters all the time you might think not so, but at the moment i do not play shooter games that much)- You can barely get out of ammo and therefore the melee weapon is just a style way to killl (most weapon spots have unlimited amount of resupply)- The mobs randomly spawn and sometimes they don't see you at all although you are right in front of them- 3-5 hours of gameplay for 7gb to download is not realy efficient.- Decard can actually jump like 5-10 centimeters high... that is so unrealistic and makes it quite clear where you have to go..- The whole world arround you dies, you actually have nothing to fear at all as you are never in a realy huge threat... lame...- probably some points i have forgotten Result:This game is not realy worth to play, BUT when you see it for its saleprice of not even 1€ (0,95 or sth like that) you can pick it up.. this game is so terrible in many stages that it is actually fun to play because it is so bad.It is worth the 1€ but not the 5€ it is soldProbably a 3-4 / 10It had potential to be a good game but the potential was not used correctly so it became a quite bad but still playable (no replay value at all) game

content:
3, 2016
												This game is the textbook definition of an "ok" game.It plays well enough, is engaging at times, has some interesting mechanics, and has an alright storyline. But that's the thing. Everything is just "alright". Legendary sits on the fence between good and bad to the point where it's a bit forgettable. It's not so bad it's good (looking at you Bad Rats), but its not good enough to be memorable either. There are some things I liked though. The graphics aren't stellar, even for the time it came out, but a lot of care clearly went into the environments. Some of them are pretty creative and look really nice. The little magic-y mechanic is reminiscient of Bioshock, but it adds a little something to the game as well. Overall all though the game is just your standard "pew pew, shoot the monsters" fare with a particularly dissapointing ending. It may not be horrendous, but its not great either. Unfortunately that puts a somewhat enjoyable game like Legendary firmly in the forgettable category. Still, I'd say the game is worth picking up on sale. Just don't expect too much out of it.

content:
er 20, 2016
												Wow... Legendary is just bad. Legendary is just... everything wrong with modern games. Legendary is overly scripted, easy (when it wasn't easy it was just cheap and artificially difficult), boring and out right dumb.So, before I start my rant about this piece of ♥♥♥♥, you're probably asking "What's this game about?".Legendary is about cliches. Everything is cliches in this pile of ♥♥♥♥. You play as Deckard, a thief, who is the most boring character ever. ♥♥♥♥ing literally, he just wears a suit and he's completely silent. So Deckard is hired by Lefay, the obviously not evil corporate man, to find and open Pandora's box. Deckard, like the moron he is, finds the box and puts his hand over the big obvious hole and gets his ♥♥♥♥ing hand impaled, imbuing him with the completely boring video game powers of healing and pushing (although it only works on some enemies for some reason), and opening Pandora's Box in the process. This releases the mythical bullet sponges across the grey lands of earth.And this is why the game is ♥♥♥♥. It takes itself so serious. Everything is grey, dull, and desaturated. Even locations like Big Ben are made boring because the devs can't lighten up. One of the only joys in the game I got, in the form of laughter, came when the kracken destroys big ben and you hear one of your friendly face-less troops yell "It's destroying Big Ben!" in the background, as if I'm too stupid to know it's Big Ben.As you probably guess, this is one of those ♥♥♥♥♥♥ games where brain-dead AI Team mates follow you around, and whenever you enter a new big corridor shooting gallery you always end up on the same side of your teammates, with the enemy humans on the other side, and the werewolves running around doing whatever the ♥♥♥♥ they want. It gets so damn repititive when you realize EVERY level is this... all eight of them... for 4 hours...In terms of just the gameplay, it sucks. The most common enemies are the werewolves. These ♥♥♥♥ers are annoying. If they hit you the camera flips out and flies everywhere. This is compounded by the fact that big red claw marks come on your screen, ♥♥♥♥ing up your vision. It doesn't help the aiming sucks. This is another ♥♥♥♥♥♥ modern game that insists on using ADS and Iron Sights. Now, I have liked games with Iron Sights (Far Cry 2, as one example), but overall they're dumb as a mechanic. It fills up to much of the screen, and the only reason it exists to to slow down the sticks for consoles. But it's a huge problem in Legendary. Why? Because the mouse sensitivity goes to ♥♥♥♥ when you aim down sights (there's no option for it exclusively, either), it's so bad it's near impossible to hit anything while using it. You might just say "don't use them, fire from the hip". But you can't do that either, because the accuracy for the guns are so bad if you don't ADS. This led to me just tanking damage to get close to human enemies, which honestly wasn't that hard. It actually may have been harder to play it the way you're supposed to (Given the mouse control ACTUALLY WORKED), at longer ranges, because the weapons suck so hard. I recently played through Far Cry 1 for the first time, which has amazing mouse controls (as it was actually built for M+KB, and not just thrown together like this pile of ♥♥♥♥), and it was actually fun to use the weapons (despite how insane that game is with those trigen ♥♥♥♥ers).So... yeah. All of the mythical bullet sponges feel the same. The alpha werewolves are just soak up more bullets than the regular ones do. Griffins (the like two times you fight one without a rocket launcher, which one hit kills them, by the way), along with the minotaurs, are once again, just glorified bullet sponges. Minotaurs are the worst in the game, by far, as you have to fight two of them EVERY SINGLE TIME after you encounter the first one. And these ♥♥♥♥♥♥♥s can probably take more than 30 shotgun shells to the face, each. The game's Netricsa- I mean PDA says you can do more damage by shooting them in the back (Super creative, I know), but good luck with that. They're almost always facing you, pretty much no matter what.That brings me to the PDA. If you've ever wanted to know how NOT to write video game logs, this is the game for you. There's literally a line that says "I bet this guy doesn't fart without checking rules and regulations". Brilliant. Sometimes you can find logs laying around the world. Most of them amount to one or two sentences (Suck on that Deus Ex) that almost have nothing to do with the story and are so laughably written. Look at my most recent screenshot for this game, you'll see the worst one in there (and it's one of the longer ones, too).So yeah, this game suxorz, never buy it, even on sale. The only reason I played through it was I had it back on the 360 in like 2009. As you can imagine, I sold it after beating the first new york levels. I wanted to finally return to it (after I bought it for like a dollar on a sale like two years ago) and see where the ♥♥♥♥ splattered. It was way worse than I remember.There's so many stupid things, like why is Deckard running around in a ♥♥♥♥♥♥ suit? Why doesn't his friends at the order of 86 give him a suit of power armor, like everyone else has. I also find it funny that you don't open a single door in the entire game. Yep... not a single one.The only thing I liked was at the last level you could see the head of the statue of liberty in rubble and ♥♥♥♥. It totally reminded me of the poster to Escape From New York.Whatever, don't buy it. It's one of the worst games I've ever played. Going next to Metal Gear Solid V and Alien Isolation on the mantle of ♥♥♥♥.-MandatoryAlcatraz

er 15, 2015
												It's decentPro's:Enemy's are interestingMid:Story, narration, and delivery is awkward but cheesyCon's:Weapon varietyLevel DesignLevel textures sometimes doesn't loadDetails:The enemy designes aren't per say interesting, it's more of how you deal with them.  Some you can only shoot the head, others only the back, others when their mouth is open, etc.  I wish more games did that with their enemies, and sometimes they will react to getting shot.  The story is... interesting but also stupid, the way it's told is kinda forced and kinda half-♥♥♥♥♥ at the same time, a few conversations are interesting but the story is mostly a few cutscenes and some hidden messages all through out the levels.  There are only around half a dozen weapons through the whole game, and there are clear better weapons. The levels themselves are hit and miss, sometimes you'll be powering up something while a team gets your back, other times your wading through set-peices, and other times you have no idea what the hell you need to do to continue forward.  And sometimes when you play for long periods, the textures in the levels don't load; not just on objects like cars or rocks, but whole water-ways, backgrounds, even enemies.You get around 6-8 hours of gameplay from this game, and for that price, I think it's worth it if your looking for something to waste 6-8 hours on, you can do a hell of a lot worse.

												I got this game for 18 cents and it provided me a couple hours of fun. Of course it's not a great game, there's lack of variation in enemies, and it'd be cool if you could get other powers for your Animus arm besides stagger enemies...That being said, the level design is good anf there are really fun moments.The game is very VERY on-rails and linear. It suffers a bit from being a port, and this is very obvious when zooming in and trying to aim with guns, the motion is very jittery and obviously adapted to a mouse from a controller.On the elevator to the last level you will fall through the floor, but I found a way around this simply by running straight into the back of the elevator and not stopping. Doing this will get the elevator to successfully take you to the top.All in all... the story is nothing spectacular, but if you go into your nvidia (or amd) graphics control panel and turn on vsync and FXAA this game still looks rather good and is still rather fun. I wouldn't but it for full price on steam, but if you can get it on sale for under a dollar? I don't see a better way to spend a couple of cents.

content:
3, 2016
If you own a logitech device:Disable Logitech software (G-15 keyboard/game panel) before playing (or else face HORRIFIC lag).G-15 Keyboard: This program adds an applet to LCD Manager, open the LCD manager & DISABLE IT, otherwise this game may/will run on O/S start up/log in!Fix aim sensitivity:For some screwed up reason, your aim sensitivity is faster than your normal sensitivity. This may not be the best way to fix it (maybe there's a multiplier somewhere that needs a < 1 value) but this method works!Set up your controls in-game first.Go into UserName\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config\Open "PandoraInput.ini"Adjust to your preferred mouse sensitivity at line 6. Example:MouseSensitivity=5.600000About line 1121, you're going to modify your ADS command. Follow my example, replacing my sensitivities with ones that you prefer. I found that if you take your base sensitivity and divide by 1.75, you get a good result in game (but this again is personal preference). So I would use 3.2 as my ADS sensitivity (= 5.6 / 1.75). This is what your new line should look like:Bindings=(Name="RightMouseButton",Command="GBA_AimDown | setSensitivity 3.2 | onRelease setSensitivity 5.6",Control=False,Shift=False,Alt=False)Save the file. Then set it to read only.Now you can enjoy the game 'properly' (or at least more than before :P )Game ReviewYou open Pandora's box. You stupid, sorry @$$ SOB. Now the modern day world has been filled with all kinds of mythological creatures you must fight off, on the plus side you get some special power (you can absorb energy from enemies and use it for attacks or to heal yourself). You get standard FPS weapons: pistol, smg, AR, shotgun, sniper, grenades, and an ax for melee. You have to fight through some mind strange level designs, where it's not quite clear where to go or how to get there. Fortunately you do have a waypoint marker you can bring up, but the levels take some thinking to navigate at times. You have to face some respawning enemies.... (from spawn points you sometimes can destroy) ugh... Which is annoying when you're trying to figure out where to go (or how to open the passage to where you need to go, or find a way around something). To be fair, I must mention though that ammo respawns as well.I haven't gotten very far in the game, so I can't say too much. The gun play isn't bad once you apply the sensitivity fix for ADS. The graphics are decent, the enemies are interesting (nice to fight monsters instead of always more guys with guns). Yes, it's post apocalyptic and yet the police are still concerned with hunting your ♥♥♥ down even though there are all sorts of creatures hell bent on killing all humans... and you're fighting against the monsters and the police still want you dead? Maybe I'm missing something here. I was never one to pay much attention to the story.TL;DR / Conclusion  + It's less than a $1 on sale  + The graphics and sounds are good/decent  + Varied, Interesting Enemies  + Average (but still fun) gun play  -  Navigating levels can feel like a chore at times  + Cool Story, bro. Pandora's box, Post apocalyptic setting in modern day  -  Can be buggy for some users  + If you can't get it to run, there's always steam refunds

content:
r 31, 2014
												To my mind, Legendary was the 21st century equivalent of a pulp fiction magazine.  Pros and cons:+ The story and little cinematic moments offered some enjoyable surprises, and not just of the "Ha, monster closet!  Gotcha!" variety.+ I liked the mechanic of absorbing energy (health) from corpses: it made the player character feel supernatural and gave you a reason to care about the carnage you're leaving behind.+ The setting really felt like a city torn asunder by supernatural forces on a massive scale.+ The different cryptid enemies like werewolves and griffins attacked with an animalistic quality that felt very different from, say, a shooter where you only shoot enemy humanoids.- The graphics aren't so much dated or low-tech as they are poorly executed.  Other contemporary games looked better.  In particular, the normal maps are cranked up to an unrealistic degree.- The weapons get the job done, but none of them were particularly original or tactically interesting.- There's little reason to re-play the game.Is it a good value?  Well, I liked it enough to play through the campaign over 7 hours, and as I write this the game is on sale for 49¢.  So that's 7¢ per hour of entertainment.  They know it's not on par with a $60 game, and the price reflects that.  I recommend it on that basis.

I don't know why it has such reviews but for 3 euros it's worth it.Here's the good, the bad and my own opinion.+Good atmosphere.+Suprisingly good A.I. considering it can rival some of todays A.I.s.+Great enemies. Unique and well made. Each has it's own pattern and abilities.+Nice level designs. Truly beautful views from time to time.+Good graphics considering it's from 2008.-Technical issues. The notoriuos elevator glitch happened to me, but I read that if you walk towards the walls when it's moving up you'll be fine. I did it and it works, nonetheless this is a glitch and it sucks.-Not a good console port. Especially the aiming part. When you go from normal aiming to iron sights the mouse sensitivity is like 3x more sensitive. Really frustrating.-Uninspired weapons.-Few enemie types (10 - 12).-As all whole the game is a little rough. Little things are missing like the ability to have multiple saves or having a buggy collision from time to time. When rotating a valve you can turn around and go 20 meters away from it but it still rotates. Nothing gamebreaking(except the elevator glitch which is avoided easily), just little stuff which are not well tought out.As a whole it's mediocre leanin towards beign good. It's got mediocre story and characters. For 3 euros I'd recommend it. I don't know what people expect from the game for this price, but you can't find a better FPS game for 3 euros or less than this one. You can start, play for an hour having fun and blowing some steam off and close it. It's that kind of a game. There were sections in the game that were so well made that I stopped and just stared at the panorama. It was really beautiful. So if you play this game don't compare it to a 20-60 euro game. Although rough around the edges Legendary is a good game.

content:
17, 2016
												Legendary is that odd little game that stirred up so much disappointment and controversy with FPS fans upon it's intial arrival, but nearly a decade later, is actually much better than a lot of what passes as a FPS game anymore. Granted, this title is still barely Triple-A status, but a far cry from the notorious reputation it garnered. Sadly, this title and the even-more maligned Turning Point: Fall of Liberty both made and broke it's developer Spark Unlimited, which after two failed titles sank into oblivion afterward. This was the far better-looking and far better-playing of the two major-publisher offerings it had, and even though this game's publisher (Gamecock) would also be bought then assimilated into the fold of some larger being, at least for a brief moment it showed that independant developers and publishers could still compete in the Triple-A gaming world. But enough about the back-history, onto the game.Legendary basically tells the tale of opening Pandora's Box, but in a modern setting. The player assumes the role of Charles Deckard, who is cursed with a life-absorbing sigil on his hand after breaking into the museum holding the box and opening it ubeknownst to it's true power. His employer, one Ormond LeFey, wished to unleash the horrors from the box and then wrestle control of them to rule the world with the help of his Black Order. But the Council of 98 (charged with protecting the box throughout history), jumps to Deckard's aid to try and help set things right. Decent and original enough story, just not executed with the most interesting gameplay.Legendary isn't awful, it isn't even bad, it just has very conventional Doom/Quake style blast 'em FPS gameplay against mythological baddies like werewolves, minotaurs, dragons, gryphons, Cthulu-style tentacle monsters, and even evil faeries. The garden-variety shotguns, assault rifles, SMGs, grenades etc. serve their purpose just fine, but if anything is to be a let down here, it's the Human enemies and their almost listless AI that prove to be the least entertaining of targets in the player's travels. Additionally, this game has areas of infiinte monster respawns, arbitrarily intermixed with areas of finite enemies, so the player never really knows if they should (or can) clear the area, or just muscle through in a bum-rush fashion onto the next objective. Another gripe is the cumbersome fire axe Decard caries around the whole game a la Half-Life 2's Gordon Freeman; that weapon could have easily just been an extra fillable slot for something else.Graphics were decried as underwhelming, and I agree that on the console ports, the Unreal 3 engine wasn't properly optimized (as with a lot of mid-2000's third-party titles using the then easy-to-license engine), but on PC, turning up everything to it's highest setting makes Legendary more than sufficiently pretty, if not downright gorgeoous at times, and is one of the better titles I've seen NOT made by Epic Games using the engine. Same goes with the aiming: stiff and oddly wonky on consoles, but smooth and perfectly customizable sensitivity even with gamepad on PC. I think most reviewers were playing this on Xbox 360 anyway at the time, so their arguments hold water for that platform. I remember playing this on 360 and it seemed MUCH worse than the PC version that I almost didn't decide to try due to my bad experience with the console version.Ultimately, this is simple. fantasy-fueled fun that didn't have the right amount of polish or a really hooky multiplayer to reign in enough of the mainstream market, and during a golden era of FPS games where everything was compared to Halo or Call of Duty, that was a massive no-no, in addition to a poorly optimized console port that would end up being the majority of what this game's intended audience played. This should have been more niche, spent a bit more time in the development oven for both the console ports and multiplayer aspects, and maybe Spark Unlimited would be around to this day working on this game's sequels, meaning I would be reviewing the first entry of a franchise instead of a failed attempt to break into the FPS big leagues. For the few bucks this game costs, you could have less fun playing a game on your smartphone, so give it a try.

content:
8, 2014
												One of the reviewers mentioned that there should be a "neutral" button, too, beside the thumbs-up and down selections. And how right he was! As I have found Legendary relatively mediocre I would not recommend it, but it is not a bad game, at all.Legendary is an interesting FPS. It tries to have a unique story by unleashing mythical creatures on our modern world. Minotaurs and huge werewolves stroll the streets looking for prey. And it's all because of a thief trying to steal an artifact. As there's an order behind all this you can expect to encounter human foes along the hordes of beasts. To make the gameplay a bit more interesting our protagonist has a unique power due to the use of mentioned artifact - this can be used to hurt villains but only after collecting all the energy residue left behind by monsters.There really is not much to say about Legendary. It is a mediocre game but what it was aimed at it achieves very well. There are some nice scripted sequences and some huge boss battles. Using a rocket launcher against the Kraken in London is very entertaining; at one point you come across with a huge griffin beast in a cathedral. I say some of these monster encounters are coupled with the appropriate environment to make these scenes memorable.Too bad you complete the story in a mere 5 hours and Legendary is pretty much done for as multiplayer is not played by anyone. I'd say give it a try if you have an awful lot of spare time and a very open-minded approach to these games.

												Well, I got this for 82 cents so I don't feel ripped off. I played for about an hour and am getting it refunded.It's weird. It has an OK Premise with mythological creatures attacking NYC. But there are lots of problems. You jump like Metal Mario, every single door has a keypad you have to hack into, you just can't open doors, enemies feel like paper, the voice acting is choppy, lots of bugs including a game breaking one that can be fixed from the steam forums.I don't know. I guess I just wanted a game that was dirt cheap and was an FPS but this was probably a bad idea.

content:
y 20, 2015
												A laughably bad, but oddly charming title that sometimes doesn't work but will have you rolling your eyes and chuckling the whole way through.The story sets itself off like bioshock infinite:"Why is he going TOWARDS the lighthouse/pandora's box?""Why is he opening pandora's box? Is he stupid or something? Has he even heard the ending to the myth?""Dude, he just unleashed the apocalypse. Ha. Good going, dork."The game then proceeds to be more-or-less the same kind of campy, stupid, and ridiculous bad gameplay crap-shooters are known for. The game is quite fun at times, but what makes it worth it in my opinion is how laughable it is. I mean, look at those graphics! The fov! This game is a guilty pleasure. It's not quite as "good" as chaser or ubersoldier or Red Faction 2 were, but it's well worth a good 45 minutes. Wonderful for let's plays.

number of helpful: 3 of 3 people (100%) found this review helpful
content:
4, 2012
												A marvelous game from start to finish. After being tricked into opening Pandora's Box, all hell breaks loose. Mythological creatures ranging in origin from Greece to Japan spread across the Earth destroying every major city. You need to make your way to fight the man who tricked you and left you for dead.The animations were so great in this game. In any given Apocalypse, Zombie, or Horror movie/game, nameless soldiers will die. This game is no exception. I almost just wanted to kick back and watch as the werewolves brutally slaughtered every ally I had because it seemed like every time I turned, they were being killed in some new way.And I mean, come on! What other game lets you take down a Gryphon with a rocket launcher?!

content:
12, 2016
												You can try this game  if you want to play a simple FPS : go there , kill the things , go there , activate that thing or shoot that thing and you can go further , not really a lot to explore : "tunnel FPS".  Average game but it's rather good for its price and its age, I mean how many times have you bought some old game to discover that the pixels hurt your eyes and that the gameplay is horrible. You don't have to notice the lore,  it's a plus for simple Shooty game . You don't have to think too much so it's a relaxing game for when you just want to destroy a few werewolves or toad-fire-monsters.The healing system is original , you don't regenerate like in modern games and you can't find medikits, you have to harvest the magic energy coming from dead monsters but that energy can't be found on the human soldiers you have to kill too, so sometimes you have to strategize who or what you want to kill first if you need to heal up  but that side of the game is minor because the game is not that hard in normal mode ( I've not tested any other difficulty).The only regret I have about this game is that there is not enough different weapons in it and all the weapons are usual ones ( pistol, shotgun, machine gun , automatic rifle, heavy machine gun, bazooka) plus a flamethrower . It's a game about myhtical creatures and "magic" energy they could have added exotic abilities or special weapons .Also, if your PC is powerful you're probably going to meet a bug where you fall through a lift near the end , the fix from the steam forum :------------PawPaw 04-04-2009, 11:38 AMhere is a fix that works for most people.Open the PandoraEngine.ini (on vista it is on C:\Users\USERNAME\Documents\My Games\Legendary\PandoraGame\Config-Folder) and search for"MaxSmoothedFrameRate=300" and change the value to 60. So the game runs at maximum 60 fps. Play through to next check point save then edit it back to 300 and continue game.If a setting of 60 does not work try 30.Game will not run so good but it's only a short level to next checkpoint where you can then reset back to 300. ---------

number of helpful: 39 of 73 people (53%) found this review helpful
content:
, 2014
												Legendary: The Box is a 5-hour linear Call of Duty style cinematic setpiece FPS. You play as a dude who is hired to open Pandora's Box by an Evil Mad Scientist who runs some sort of Private Mercenary Cult. When you do, monsters come out. The monsters including werewolves, minotaurs, and gryphons. And the Kraken. In the second level, you kill a giant trash golem that wrecks time Square. The Kraken wrecks Big Ben. In the end, you overload Pandora's Box with Cyber Energy or something and then the bad guy dies. The ending sets you up for a sequel where, like, your Cyber Energy lets you control the monsters and as it turns out the good guys were a bad evil government or something all along.The shooting is not particularly good. Enemies are a bit spongy and don't react to being shot, except Alpha Werewolves, whose skin starts to fall off. Both types of Werewolves need to be decapitated or they will revive themselves, doing so with the axe is pretty fun the first few dozen times. Unfortunately since they're one of the game's main enemies, it gets old. Quickly. AI is pretty weak. Guns: Assault Rifle, Machine Gun, Rocket Launcher, Shotgun, Pistol, end-of-game Flamethrower, axe. You can carry two at once. The boss fights all have unlimited ammo rocket supplies near them. Hmm.There are no real branching paths, even areas that should be open have debris blocking your way so you're funneled through the linear intended path. You go through sewers. It hits all the clichés. Occasionally you stop to push a switch or turn a valve or fight waves of enemies until the game decides to let you go on. There are data diaries you can pick up. They have riveting anonymous text like "We're going to have to take a run for it the monsters are everywhere". The PC version does not have achievements and there is no in-game incentive to find the diaries. I stopped reading them after a level or two.The game would have taken me less than 5 hours, but the checkpointing is pretty poor so expect to repeat long walking segments when you manage to get yourself killed at the end. I also ran into a 100% guaranteed bug just before the last checkpoint of the game that causes you to fall through the level geometry. To solve it you need to edit an INI to either bind a noclip to some control or to cap the framerate of the game at 30. This did not endear me to the game. It is well documented on Steam discussion forums.One of the more positive reviews of the game claims it's 8 hours long. I'm sorry, it's just not. It just isn't. Again, I died a bunch and fell through the game's geometry a bunch at the end and had to restart and fiddle with that and I got to a hair over 5 hours on Normal difficulty. It's not an 8 hour game.The game has a hard rock soundtrack and a pretty bad attitude. It's almost a horror FPS except that it's not scary, it's just... abrasive. Like you're constantly being yelled at, I guess. It's very loud. There are sporadic moments that are sort of inventive but mostly they're covered by sort of a very generic game shell.Did I hate it? Well, no, not really. It's functional. It probably doesn't deserve a 50 Metacritic when there are games that are similarly bad or worse and have 25 points higher because they have big name IP or had big publishers. Like, Homefront has a 70 average score. If Homefront is a 70, this is a 70-ish. But do I recommend it? Not really. It's not a great use of your time. You're not going to finish it and say "well, it was rough around the edges but this and this and that were kind of cool". Like, Walking Dead: Survival Instinct is not a good game, but it at least tried and failed to do stuff. Legendary doesn't really feel like it tried, most of the time. I didn't try the multiplayer, which is a GameSpy casualty.

content:
r 6, 2014
												Good day together, I have seen a lot of reviews with less than 1 hour playtime and I wanted to finish the game at least before I write my opinion here. Sadly  I wasn`t able to finish the game but I will write what I think.Story (short version..): You stole Pandoras Box and opended it. Suddenly you got superpowers from opening the box and a lot of monsters got summoned to the earth. Like Drakes, Griffins, Ghosts, Werwolfes and stuff... A bad guy wants to controll them and you are the only one who can stop him. Gameplay: The graphics are ok......For a 2008 game at least. You can sprint 10 metres than your character is breathing like he is going to die. The jump is sometimes completly broken, you cant jump over 20cm obstacles.The weapons are nothing special, you have a pistol, small machinegun, big machinegun, assaultrifle, flamethrowers and 2 types of grendes and a rocket launcher.Whats most annoying is that sometimes you dont know how to proceed. There are endless spawning enemies, do I need to fight or to run? Sometimes you need to kill a certain amout of enemies so something happens, And sometimes you just have to kill the spawner of the enemies to proceed. If you dont do exactly what the game wants from you, you die. Jump over a wall you shouldn`t = kill. Solve a "puzzle" otherwise than planned = kill. Thats frustrating and very sad coded. Before I just list some points that were cool on the game or sh itty I have to say  that I COULDN`T FINISH THE GAME. Because in the last level on an elevator I ALWAYS fall through the map and die. Loaded the map several times and I couldn`t fix the bug. That was the time to uninstall for me. If something serious like this doesn`t get patched you know how much the devs care about their game. Positive aspects of the game:+ The music was overall very awesome.+ The scenery was well done with all the nonstop explosions and the feeling you are really in a war between factions. + The other soldiers who mostly follow you give you a feeling that you arent alone in this "war". + Funny ideas like, you try to open a door but you can`t because suddenly a ghost appears and took away the handle, made me smile at least. + Story is ok to understand and you know at least what you are fighting for. - KI incredible stupid and own allies completly useless. - Enemies are bulletsponges like hell. A centaur and griffons are able to absorb 2 minutes of nonstop gunfire which is just dumb.- Named allis got too less of personality that you could care about them. - Jumping is broken and you feel like you can`t even pass a blade of grass. - TOO much ammo around every corner. - The superpowers feel really useless. The nonstop absorbing souls to heal the own life is just more annoying than fun. Medipacks would have done the job I guess. Potential wasted there...- 9000! Wasnt able to finish the game due to a gamebreaking bug where I always fall through the ground...Peace Hexor.

content:
ry 2
												This game could have been a great game. Just see Shadow Warrior, it has almost the exact same storyline but is amazing. However, there were some things that make this game bad.Jumping and iron sights are broken. You jump either one foot or 30 feet depending if you hold down the run button or not. It's completely random.Iron Sights are not affected by changing the mouse speed. So if you're like me and like a slower scroll you suddenly are all over the map with iron sights. I was literally getting motion sick briefly at times.RNG fights. The giant squid or Kraken attacking seems to be mostly random with the deaths. I hate RNG in fights.The jumping puzzle early on in the game at the warehouse. This is because of course jumping is broken. This is beatable but frustrating.The infinite mobs. You don't see this in modern games too often for a reason. People like to clear areas.Not much variety of enemies. All of mythology and you have werewolves, minitaurs (five of them), tentacles, ghosts, lava monsters and that's it... all of mythology and that's all? And of course the obvious fraud. Yes, Fraud. They sell a game that is unfinished and will simply crash on most people's computers. I'm going to try a few more times for this elevator bug but this is fraud.

content:
9, 2014
												I bought this game for around 70 cents, so I'm going to give it a thumbs up.Do you like mythology? Do you like mythological creatures?Well I sure hope you do, because this game is literally throwing all sorts of mythos at you with no legitimate reason at all. Sure, Pandora's Box opened and is unleashing hell on New York, but who really cares? Well obviously you do since you were branded by Pandora's Box and now have the power to absorb the creature's life force. Jewish mythos? There. Greek mythos? Obviously. Irish mythos? Why not! Heck it even has the mythological creature of obscure cultrures. Thanks, Legendary.Why did all of this happen? What did New York do?Well okay, you're some sort of person who does dangerous and odd jobs. For example, mowing the lawn for that old lady who lives on the incredibly steep hillside. Your back's gonna need some time to recover from all that leaning. But really, this old rich dude is obviously the spokesperson of white capitalism and asks you to insert a key into Pandora's Box. Because unleashing hell for about $10,000 is a good investment, right? Of course it is, Deckard.All in all, I give this game a 7/10. The gameplay is dull, the voice acting is alright I guess, and the graphics aren't anything to write home about. Though the real seller for this game is the fact that those GRIFFONS LOOK SO MENACING AND COOL LIKE HOLY COW I WANNA HAVE THAT GRIFFON'S MYTHOLOGICAL HUMAN-EAGLE-LION BABIES. And ♥♥♥♥, it was 99 cents. Not really, it was like 70-something.

16, 2015
												By far one of the worst games I've played in the last decade.It's amazing how this game excels in complete and utter mediocrity, it seems the 'designers' went out of their way to get pretty much everything you can get wrong in a game, wrong.Some of the highlights:- Horrible mouse controls, insane mouse acceleration on iron sight (making it pretty much impossible to hit anything)- No FOV slider, and the FOV is way too narrow.- Horrible animation, characters are clunky and actions are often without purpose.- Terribly bad and uninspired level design.- Even on release it looked very much outdated.- Overall design is uninspired and without any direction or artistic vision.- A bug that has never been fixed even to this day, that prevents you from actually finishing the game. Without editing the settings file so you can noclip/ghost through the walls (if you even make it this far) this game can't be finished.- Absolutely horrendously placed collisions (the dreadful jumping in this game even exacerbates the problem.)- Terrible play time padding mechanics (keep E pressed for 10 seconds to open a door)- Sprinting with a cool down that last longer than you can actually sprint (which is about 2 seconds, it's like you're playing with an asthmatic 70 year old chain smoker.)Anyway, you get the point.It's  amazing that I can actually think of not one redeeming quality this game might have, absolutely none, which is actually quite the achievement.Actually, that's not true, the one redeeming quality that this game has is that the play time is so short (4 hours), you might actually finish the game before giving up in utter boredom or disgust.Avoid this game at all costs, even if it where offered for free.

content:
er 3, 2016
												I'm very disappointed in this game on pc - played it first on xbox and loved it. I love the griffons and other creatures involved, liked the story, and even the achievements were fun (and full of puns). But this version is very buggy, gamebreakingly so. It really destroys the experience to play this on pc. The Steam version doesn't have achievements either which would not be as disappointing in every game, but was disappointing in this one because I know achievements already exist for it, just apparently not here. As a game I'd recommend it, because it's fun and cool and has excellent griffons and is different from the usual and their achievement puns are the best, but as a game on Steam I would not recommend it for any price as it is broken (as in, unable to complete the game due to unavoidable bugs). So, no, I do not recommend *this* game. Go try it on xbox!

number of helpful: 2 of 3 people (67%) found this review helpful
content:
15, 2014
												Legendary is interesting game to say the least. You play as Deckard a theif hired to steal Pandora's Box. You then end up unlocking the box and releasing Legendary creatures to cause havoc among the world with the new found power you gained from the box it's up to you to stop what you had set in motion.The power given to you is the ability to absorb the spirits of fallen creatures and either use it to heal yourself or push enemies out of your face. The enemies themselves are pretty interesting and varied. The Werewolves are certainly a favorite of mine because Werewolves won't stay dead unless decapitated, meaning after knocking one down you have to go and chop it's head off before it gets back up, unless of course you were aiming for the head then with a well placed headshot they won't be getting back up. The weapons feel a bit weak and one even sounds like a laser gun but that doesn't mean they are weak. there is a decent enough mix of weapons to change up how you play but it doesn't really matter once you find something you like you will most likely stick with it. Also ammo is scattered all over the game so don't worry too much about it however don't just go around soraying down corridors either.Speaking of corridors this game is VERY linear. it's a straight forward path the entire wa through. Now for me this isn't nessicarilly a bad thing but for others it may be an issue especially for those who enjoy exploring.TL:DR I enjoyed my experience with Legendary and it may have some things that turn people off I still like it and recommend it especially given it's current price. Side note just wanna go ahead and say it I feel like this game deserves a reebot. With the technology we have today we could improve this game perhaps make it more open don't make Deckard a mute character and tweak the enemies a bit and it would make a great new gen game.

content:
29, 2016
												For a game that came out in 2008, during a time when it had a lot to compete with in the shooter genre, Legendary was suprsingly good! There wasn't much to do with games then as AI was limited and graphics were too but the devs definately made a playable combination of diffculty and entertainment. If you like mythology and big, violent creatures tearing people apart, this game is for you. If you get bored VERY EASILY with linear gameplay, this game is not for you. It was 2008 when this came out, remember, there weren't a whole bunch of open ended games then. If I could fix two things, I would have asked for more weapons/animus abilites and better collision detection. There are times where you're running in a straight line to escape an enemy and you suddenly stop - not because you meant to but because your character got stuck on a penny-sized bump on the sidewalk or a plant. Seriously. Other than those two minor hiccups, the game was great for what it was and when it was made. Over all, 8/10. 2 points off for aforementioned problems/issues.

content:
28, 2011
												I originally bought a boxed copy of this game on a whim in Jan 2009.  I had never seen it before and it looked different from the usual fare so I decided to give it a try.  I really enjoyed it, despite a few bugs.  It received some really bad press from IGN and Gamespot, which is odd because when they previewed the game's beta they gave it high marks, so I'm guessing Spark Unlimited couldn't pay for a good review the way some of the larger devs can.  I no longer trust review sites.I'm going to set the record straight.  Legendary is a pretty good title that's been largely overlooked.  Gameplay is familiar in that it's a fairly straight-forward shooter with a few puzzle elements thrown in.  You get everything from a fire axe to anti-aircraft missiles for an arsenal and gun-toting baddies to a 20-story collosus and everything inbetween for enemies.  If you like running and gunning and fighting monsters with the whole world falling down around you, give it a try.  It's only $10.
