												I know the second you saw this you were confused. Legendary a good game?!?!? But I am being serious here. I loved this game. Everyone says either "It is pretty moderate for a shooter" or "Bad game"  which I don't understand at all. I had more fun with this shooter than COD! In COD you fight a bunch of similair stupid ♥♥♥ enemies who have no special abilities at all. Or you play an average zombie survival mode. Or you play online agains't a bunch of screaming kids and swearing adults with absolutely no innovation at all even in the sequels it is almost exactly the same. What happens in Legendary? Griffins swoop down picking up enemies in their mouths and eating them. Werewolfs lunge at you and throw objects at you and when they are killed you have to chop of their heads or they recuperate. Fire drakes shoot fire out of their mouths at you but can be taken care of by activating a sprinkler or shooting a fire extinguisher. And while you are doing this a MASSIVE golem above is smashing through buildings and stepping on fleeing people. Also a giant tentacled beast is grabbing allies and pulling them to a watery grave. And guess what. Those tentacles can also grab you and the golem can also step on you. All these mythical creatures from different cultures are trying to kill you while you are trying to destroy a golem by activating 3 EMPs to seperate the energy of the golem from the body. Explosive spiders from Japan, Fire Drakes from old tales and a Kraken from common folklore. My favourite creature is the Nari. A creepy bat like creature with a childs face who can become a ghost and              a physical creature. They often possess objects and throw them at you and generally make life a pain. They steal objects needed for objectives and force you to chase them down often leading you to traps. One time a Nari stole a valve I needed to proceed and dropped it in a suspicious looking chamber. When I entered the doors closed and a fan possessed by the Nari  started sucking me towards it. Only by shooting the supports could I barely escape and when I did I was attacked by a tentacle and almost pulled towards my doom. And that is only level 2. The only bad thing I would say about this game is the graphics however because of the graphics it works on less powerful computers like mine. Some of the most popular games also have bad graphics like HL2 and Killing Floor but noone complains about that. All in all I would give it an 8/10. Definitely worth playing and fun.

												If it's on sale- I bought it for $0.74- definitely worth the price. I wouldn't spring more than maybe $2 or $3 for it though. It's fun enough to hold your attention, and it's different enough to be intriguing. Worth a few hours of your time, and if you don't like it, you're only out a buck.PROSIntriguing story.Just enough interactive elements to make it somewhat immersive.A different take on combat than you sometimes see. For example, some beasties you might have to injure in a very specific way in combat or after they are felled to win. It's different, and you'll have to think on what you know of mythology to really get it, which makes the plot that much more immersive.  Some of the environment is destructable and has to be destroyed to logically solve a puzzle to get to the next stage.CONSSomewhat on rails as you're essentially guided from one area to another by the environment. The intrigue is taken away if you read the notes on the creatures and such as they're somewhat spoilerific. Although much of the environment is interactive or destructable, enough of it isn't that it's easy to forget to try to puzzle through it as if it were a real-life or Dungeons and Dragons type game.

ber 23, 2014
												Firstly, there's a bug on the final level requiring you to rewrite the ingame code limiting your max FPS to 30, just to get to the final boss.Secondly, everything is pregenerated, and not completely random i.e. spawns, certain interactions and checkpointed events.Mechanicly speaking, it's a decent game, but not worth the full price.  No replay value at all, and feels too repetitive. If you want a similar game to this with a higher replay value, I would recommend Darkness 2.  This game lacks way too many things to be any good, like in depth character development, decent story plot (in a game like this that's kind of important) has random difficulty scaling at times. All around one time play through value and that's it.

content:
2015
												Bypass Simulator 20081/10 "Too much bypass in this game".No, seriously, don't buy this game. You'll regret it. Even for 0,49€. All the game is about bypassing doors. The gameplay is just horrible. When you shoot with an automatic weapon, half of the time you can't move your mouse. When an ennemi (Which spawn without stopping, too much ennemi, don't expect to kill all of them, it's impossible) hit you, the camera of your head mooves and you can't do and understand anything. The ennemi humans don't miss a shot (They always hit you) and the end of the game is just f*cking hard, even in normal. You can also be killed by nothing, maybe too much oxygene in the air. Weapons are useless against monsters (Except for the Rats/Wolves) and you'll have to bypass with them nearby. Your team (because they'll be there sometimes) is absolutely useless because they always die fast (Even with an armor, what you don't have). Monsters can kill them in 1 shot. Also, they somtimes hide behind a wall to shoot at the ennemies, and covering again. But they hit the wall so it's useless. The scenario is ok, but ideas are not used correctly. The game is so much scripted. Last con is checkpoints. Always put where you don't need it. At the end of the game, if you are to the point of win and you die, you'll restart at the beginning and you'll have to do the same hard thing.Overall, the game is boring, frustrating and i don't recommend you to buy it.

												Totally worth the $0.94 that I paid for it. It's linear FPS mayhem with a lil' bit of magic. Storyline is decent, but the game was told and wrapped up well. Controls are tight, but jumping up/down is cosmetic, however you can sprint-jump gaps. I wish the campaign was a little longer and that there were more big bosses. This game could use a sequel. 8/10(on sale) Would buy at that price, and play again. There is NOT a multiplayer.

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
7, 2014
												A modern-themed FPS where you fight mythical beasts with modern weapons. Showing it's age now, I still enjoyed it. Sadly the game ends with a cliffhanger and time has already told there was no sequel to this property. If none of that bothers you or you are not past a little retro-gaming, this could be a fun choice if you pay a pittance during a sale -- Fighting werewolves and Griffons with a machine gun can be fun... and they do an alright job of portraying the horror and chaos of modern forces and civilians trying to grapple with the sudden appearance of monsters. Not a bad game. I played it to the hilt.

												Legendary is a good game in general, it is very linear upon the storyline as there are many invisible walls trying to prevent you from wandering around into meaningless places, the combat in it seems to be decent; for the time it was made that is. There are afew jump scares in it which keep the gamer from falling asleep but, if you are somebody who likes completing games this is not the game for you as on the last level there is a glitch in which you fall through the floor making it impossible to complete the game, i spent 3 hours playing it and completed everything (up to the glitch that is) so if you are looking for a game to last you some time dont buy this game. But all in all i had fun playing this game :)

number of helpful: No ratings yet
content:
9, 2014
												I had a great time with this game, i walked into it expecting problems due to the reviews but i never once encountered a noticable glitch or failure, there is one thing that i hated the most about this game, the jumping you jump like an inch, and it feels like there shouldn't even be jumping, but if you want to go 30 mph just get to a ledge and sprint jump off, you'll go flying. This game has alot of cool moments, but at other times it feels a tad bit boring. Especially at the end, there isn't any feeling of urgency during the final level. I only died once, and it was because one of the monsters in this game, the minotaur, is a pain in the ♥♥♥. He will constantly follow you, running at your pace unless your sprinting, he flawless tails you even when charging, he runs through the walls in the arenas, that they put you in to fight him, flawlessly, it's like he can walk through the damn things. The game tells you to shoot him in the back, and that is super difficult because he rarely charges and when he does, it's hard to dodge. Every other enemy though is easy to fight. This game will turn into a puzzle game easily, there will be times where you have no idea what to do, and the solution is so obvious you don't notice it. The weapon switch is super slow. When you try to heal yourself with the "aminus" juice you have, it takes a little longer than it should, and is hard to control. God help you if you're trying to pick up a weapon while running if you're being chased, it's a huge thing that would've helped me during a lot of battles. On the good side the cutscenes, soundtrack, atmosphere is amazing, the AI is ok, i've seen them do some stupid ♥♥♥♥ though. Overall for five dollars i think this is a steal, if you like games with good graphics that run well even on the highest settings with bad pc parts, this is your game, my ram runs at like 500 mhz, and i ran it on highest settings.

er 19, 2014
												I bought this for $0.76, beat it in 5 hours, then unistalled it. Will I ever play it again? Probably not. Was it worth it? Yes. Well, considering the price, I can't really complain. FPS are my favorite genre and Legendary does everything a Half-Life type FPS should do, in an average-to-subpar way. I will say that the menu screen are horrible, but who cares?. Gunplay was fine, premise was cool, execution was a off in a lot of places, no real biggie. Story-wise I didn't really care/pay attention, but I knew what I was getting into for a $0.76 game. One thing, however, that bugged me about the story: the game just sorta ends. Like in "Did It glitch and play the credits" sort of way. Ehh. At the end of the day, however, this is the cheapest game I have ever bought on steam or anywhere else. I probably would have paid the whopping full price of $5 if I hadn't found it on sale first and been just as happy.

												Decent.Bought it cheap on Halloween Sale.Story: Decent. Some points are predictable, but it keeps you going. A good author could novelize the game into something much better. Graphics: Decent. Grayscaled Unreal Engine 3.Creatures: Good. I enjoyed reading the description on the in-game protagonist PDA. They researched their monsters.Gameplay: Decent. Mildly repetitive & linear. The introduction of new monsters every little while makes it intresting.There is a glitch in the final level of the game that can be fixed manually by use text editor to edit one of the game's files. That sucked!If you catch it on sale, it's worth a few hours of play. The hate it receives is too much.

content:
6, 2014
												Legendary. The game that *tried* to look like it was going to be open world.This game was a complete disgrace and I wish I never dropped 2 bucks on this crap. The tutoial, understandingly linear even felt like it was acting like a open world game.With the 19 (really about 12 minutes) I played of this game felt like hours. I got out of the tutorial; only for more open world (not really; but we made it look like it), it plays a cutscene. And another cutscene.Anyway; outside of it's not open world gameplay, You get meteoker voice acting, Bad writing, Linear as hell gameplay, Bad levels, etc. Just,  Not fun.  The story goes you are in some museum, you put your hand in "Pandora's box", and OH HEY THIS THING IS MAGIC. Now you have magic powers as the museum begins collapsing and various myths start popping out (You know; this could EASILY become a ghostbusters game at this point) and you have to run to the metro then in which case you have to make this jump (that you have to figure out how to cross yourself) THEN keep running to the metro while miracoulously NOT being murdered by these things while cars are being flung at various people closing   and all open world opprotunities [/b]  for that level. Then; you get into the metro and the SAME CRAP HAPPENS. At which point I decided to stop playing.Had the game captured me better I would feel good about playing the rest.The final rating for this game as I see it is about a 20/10. It has a great idea for a game; but horribly made.
